function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Blurred boundaries between water services and public health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of human wastewater to track diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on sewage-based monitoring for disease detection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Monitoring wastewater effluents from hospitals for virus spread","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encouragement of remote working and digital twins may lead to reduced physical interaction, impacting social and professional dynamics.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased reliance on digital platforms for utility operations may result in data security and privacy risks.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater raises concerns about potential transmission and public health risks through sewage epidemiology.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerable households at risk of water supply cut off, leading to a threat to public health due to the inability to practice regular handwashing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreased revenue from water service leading to potential costly breakdowns and permanent closure of businesses or industries","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Safe working conditions and protective equipment required for water utility staff","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective conventional treatment for pharmaceutical compounds may lead to water contamination","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in treated effluent for beneficial uses due to reduced consumption","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Blurring of boundaries between conventional engineering and socio-technical management in the water sector","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in wastewater concentration and decrease in flow may lead to the accumulation of solids, causing odors, corrosion, and equipment damage.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of flushable material such as toilet wipes and protective masks in wastewater may cause clogging of sewer systems and pumping stations.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in concentration of pharmaceutical products in wastewater may lead to environmental contamination and health risks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in chlorine dose in drinking water distribution","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in water consumption patterns","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in water demand and citizen behavior due to pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relaxing environmental regulations to mitigate economic crisis","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction of commercial and industrial activity leading to changes in water discharges","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased digitalization in the water sector due to the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transformation toward digitalization altering the water-human-data nexus","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unique opportunity to develop the water sector and catalyze key preparation for combating climate change","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on urban water cycle","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data mining from sewers through digitalisation","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Monitoring public health measures in sewers","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of flexible approach in implementing measures for different building typologies and purposes","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for more research in developing effective win-win solutions for resilience and sustainability","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The pandemic outbreak creates economic crisis and major social implications, leading to potential health risks and impacts on the built environment.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The search for resilience in response to infectious diseases must also ensure a more sustainable built environment with a positive balance between health and social, economic, and environmental aspects.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Structural leverage and disruptive change are needed to achieve a sustainable built environment that addresses the risks associated with infectious diseases and other environmental challenges.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of diseases in the built environment due to close proximity and shared spaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Temporary or intermittent measures that mitigate the risk of transmission without bringing long-term sustainability benefits.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of poor air quality and ventilation contributing to the spread of diseases, including covid-19, in non-residential buildings.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate alterations to the built environment in response to contagious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of scientific advances and knowledge about diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Negative social and economic impact of social confinement measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased probability of infectious diseases due to climate change","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of systemic approaches in addressing public health in the built environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of the built environment on disease transmission and public health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduced funding for sustainable development goals due to covid-19 crisis","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Emphasis on private vehicle travel over public transport due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of infectious diseases in interconnected urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social inequalities leading to higher vulnerability to infectious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate support for vulnerable populations in the built environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for virus residence on surfaces and materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation and airflow in buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of sustainable and resilient design in urban areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on covid-19 risk reduction measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"}]}
